result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raheem Moore

defendant.name: Moore, Raheem
defendant.address: 2209 West Silver Spring Drive, Milwaukee, WI 53209

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Defendant Raheem Moore not in court, in custody.  Attorney Michael J Steinle in court for Raheem Moore.  Attorney Matthew James Torbenson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea hearing.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms
Status conference scheduled for October 3, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Room 620SB / 9:44

Defendant Raheem Moore in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Raheem Moore in custody.  Matthew James Torbenson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defense counsel advises Court he has reviewed discovery however there is some additional discovery which has not yet been received.  Further, he has not yet received an offer from the State.
Court orders case adjourned for status in Branch 28.

Clerk:  jms

Defendant Raheem Moore in court with Attorney Michael J Steinle.  Defendant Raheem Moore in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28.   Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 065933,
Payable Number: 1019671,
Receipt Number: 22RP028394,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no contact with Shantia J. or her surviving child.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
No possession of any illgeal drugs.

CASE HEARD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL DIFFICULTIES:
Defendant Raheem Moore in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Raheem Moore in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Sanders, Branch 28. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

Attorney Steve Sargent is objecting to the case being called off the record.  Court informed defense counsel any decisions made by the Court can be reviewed by the Judge.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
